description: Looks at a specific cluster only

panels.description: Successful cluster duty percentage by type over the whole time range

Average beacon node score for the whole time window. The score is a combination of:
 - **errors**: the ratio or errors returned by the beacon node 
 - **latency**: how fast or slow the beacon node is responding


The performance of the Beacon node is critical to the performance of the validators and therefore rewards.
Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Health Status

panels.description:
Information about the charon cluster.

- **Network**: The blockchain network 
- **Operators/Nodes**: The number of operators or nodes or peers in the charon DV cluster.
- **Threshold**: The minimum number of participating nodes (also quorum).
- **Validators**: The number of validators added to the cluster, each validator is staking 32 ETH.

targets.expr:
( 1 * app_version{cluster_network="mainnet", env="$env"} )
or 
( 2 * app_version{cluster_network="goerli", env="$env"} )
or
( 3 * app_version{cluster_network="sepolia", env="$env"} )
or
( 4 * app_version{cluster_network="gnosis", env="$env"} )

panels.title: Cluster Info

panels.description: Number of charon nodes running particular consensus client versions
panels.title: Beacon Node Version

panels.description:
- **Peer**: The peer's name (inferred from their *charon-enr-private-key*)
- **You**: â­ï¸ is this local charon node
- **Connected**: Whether you are currently connected to this peer.
- **Direct**: Whether the connection is *direct* (ðŸ‘) or *relay* (ðŸ‘Ž) 
- **Latency**: The time messages take to travel to/from the peer.
- **Version**: The version of the peer's charon node
- **Supported**: Whether the peers charon version is supported/compatible or not.
- **Uptime**" The duration since peer was restarted.
- **ðŸš§Attest**: Number of attestation duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Propose**: Number of block proposal duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Other**: Number of other duties missed in the time window.

targets.expr:
(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{duty="attester", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{duty="attester", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{duty=~".*proposer", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{duty=~".*proposer", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{duty!~"(proposer|attester)", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{duty!~"(proposer|attester)", env="$env"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

panels.title: Peer Connectivity and Missed Duties (ðŸš§)

panels.description: Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Historical Health Status

panels.description:
Type of connections to each peer in the cluster during the time window:
 - ðŸŸ¢ Green: Direct connection (this is the preferred)
 - ðŸŸ¡ Yellow: Indirect relay connection (this is ok if only temporary)
 - ðŸ”´ Red: No connection to peer (this is a problem)

See https://docs.obol.tech/docs/charon/networking#external-p2p-network
panels.title: Peer Connections (ðŸŸ¢=direct, ðŸŸ¡=relay, ðŸ”´=not connected)

panels.description:
Status and balance of each validator by public key with links to beaconcha.in.

If present, the "â—ï¸Peer Exits" column indicate the number of peers that submitted partially signed exits for each validator.
panels.title: Validators

panels.description:
Warning (w) and error (e) logs grouped by topic. 

Occasional warns and errors are normal, but a significant increase indicate problems that require operators to investigate by looking at the actual logs entries.
panels.title: Warning(w) and Error(e) logs (per 2m)

panels.description: A 2D view of whether the connection between peers is direct (ðŸŸ¢) or relay (ðŸ”´)

targets.expr:
(max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="Lido x Obol: Zephyr Zorilla",cluster_hash="9b98bb8",exported_type="direct", env="$env"}) by (cluster_peer, peer, env)*10 + 
max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="Lido x Obol: Zephyr Zorilla",cluster_hash="9b98bb8",exported_type="relay", env="$env"}) by (cluster_peer, peer, env))

panels.description: Duties that was successfully broadcast to the Beacon Node, but that was never included on-chain. This could be due to broadcasting too late (too slow), but it could also just be to aspects of consensus layer out-of-our-control. See https://eth2book.info/bellatrix/part2/incentives/rewards/#remarks.
